meta.evidence_base: Practices from MBSR (Kabat-Zinn), DBT (Linehan), and contemplative traditions
meta.app_integration: Each exercise includes guided prompts, timer suggestions, and tarot correspondences

box_breathing.name: Box Breathing (4-4-4-4)
box_breathing.description: Equal counts for inhale, hold, exhale, hold. Calms nervous system.
box_breathing.why_it_works: Activates parasympathetic nervous system. Used by Navy SEALs for stress management.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Perfect balance and equilibrium. Four equal parts.

app_prompts.pre_practice: Find a comfortable position. We'll breathe together in perfect squares.
app_prompts.post_practice: How does your body feel now? Notice any changes in heart rate or tension?

box_breathing.journal_prompt: What did you notice happening in your body as you practiced? Did your mind wander?

four_seven_eight.name: 4-7-8 Breathing (Relaxing Breath)
four_seven_eight.description: Dr. Andrew Weil's technique. Natural tranquilizer for nervous system.
instructions: Close mouth, inhale through nose for 4 counts
Exhale completely through mouth for 8 counts (whoosh)
four_seven_eight.why_it_works: Longer exhale activates vagus nerve, triggering relaxation response.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Hope and healing. Star breathes life into stillness.

app_prompts.pre_practice: This breathing pattern is like a natural sedative. Let's calm your nervous system.
app_prompts.post_practice: Notice the wave of calm washing over you.

four_seven_eight.journal_prompt: Did you feel sleepy? Relaxed? What changed?

coherent_breathing.name: Coherent Breathing (5-5)
coherent_breathing.description: 5 breaths per minute. Optimal for heart rate variability (HRV).
coherent_breathing.why_it_works: Synchronizes heart rate, breath, and brain waves. Maximizes HRV (heart health indicator).

tarot_correspondences.reason: Rhythmic flow, balance in motion, sustainable practice

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's find your natural rhythm. 5 seconds in, 5 seconds out.
app_prompts.during: In...2...3...4...5. Out...2...3...4...5. Like gentle ocean waves.
app_prompts.post_practice: You just gave your heart a gift. HRV training complete.

coherent_breathing.journal_prompt: Could you find the rhythm? How did it feel after 5 minutes? After 10?

alternate_nostril.name: Alternate Nostril Breathing (Nadi Shodhana)
alternate_nostril.description: Yogic breathing to balance left/right brain hemispheres.
instructions: Close right nostril with right thumb
Close left nostril with ring finger, release right
This is one cycle. Repeat 5-10 times.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Perfect balance between two sides

app_prompts.pre_practice: We'll balance your inner energies by alternating breath between nostrils.
app_prompts.during: Close right. Breathe in left. Switch. Breathe out right. Breathe in right. Switch. Out left.
app_prompts.post_practice: Notice if your mind feels clearer, more balanced.

alternate_nostril.journal_prompt: Did one nostril feel more open? What shifted mentally?

sighing_breath.name: Physiological Sigh
sighing_breath.description: Stanford neuroscience discovery. Fastest way to reduce stress.
instructions: Double inhale through nose (big breath, then little sip of air on top)
sighing_breath.why_it_works: Re-inflates collapsed alveoli in lungs, offloads CO2, calms amygdala immediately.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Fresh breath, new beginning, instant reset

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's do the fastest stress-relief technique known to neuroscience.
app_prompts.during: Big breath in...little sip on top...looong sigh out. Again.
app_prompts.post_practice: Feel that instant relief? That's your nervous system resetting.

sighing_breath.journal_prompt: When could you use this today?

progressive_muscle_relaxation.name: Progressive Muscle Relaxation (PMR)
progressive_muscle_relaxation.description: Systematically tense and release muscle groups to release stored tension.
instructions: Start with feet: Curl toes tight for 5 seconds, release
Chest: Inhale deeply and hold, release
Full body scan: Notice the relaxation
progressive_muscle_relaxation.why_it_works: Teaches difference between tension and relaxation. Releases chronic holding patterns.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Rest, recovery, releasing what you've been holding

app_prompts.pre_practice: We'll travel through your body, tensing and releasing each part. Notice where you hold stress.
app_prompts.during: Feet: Curl tight...tighter...hold...and release. Feel the difference.
app_prompts.post_practice: Your body just released tension it's been holding for days, maybe weeks.

progressive_muscle_relaxation.journal_prompt: Where did you hold the most tension? Were you surprised?

body_scan_meditation.name: Mindful Body Scan
body_scan_meditation.description: MBSR foundation practice. Bring awareness to each body part without changing anything.
instructions: Don't try to feel anything, just observe
Move to left foot, ankle, calf, knee, thigh
body_scan_meditation.why_it_works: Develops interoception (awareness of internal sensations). Foundation for all mindfulness.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Turning inward, illuminating what's within

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's explore the landscape of your body with kind curiosity.
app_prompts.during: Left toes. What do you notice? Warmth? Coolness? Tingling? Nothing? All answers are right.
app_prompts.post_practice: You just practiced being present in your body for 20 minutes. That's powerful.

body_scan_meditation.journal_prompt: What surprised you? Any areas you couldn't feel? Where did your mind wander?

body_parts_check_in.name: 60-Second Body Check-In

tarot_correspondences.reason: Grounding in body, present moment

app_prompts.pre_practice: Quick body scan. Where are you holding tension right now?
app_prompts.during: Jaw...shoulders...hands...belly. Notice and soften.
app_prompts.post_practice: Tension spotted and released. Micro-mindfulness complete.

body_parts_check_in.journal_prompt: Which body part holds tension most often?

five_four_three_two_one.name: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding
five_four_three_two_one.description: Anxiety-interruption technique. Brings awareness to present moment through senses.
instructions: Name 5 things you can SEE (blue pen, wooden table, crack in ceiling...)
Name 4 things you can TOUCH/FEEL (smooth phone, soft shirt, cool air...)
Name 3 things you can HEAR (birds, traffic, breath...)
Name 2 things you can SMELL (coffee, soap...)
Name 1 thing you can TASTE (mint, morning mouth...)
five_four_three_two_one.why_it_works: Engages prefrontal cortex, interrupts amygdala hijack. Grounds in present reality.

tarot_correspondences.reason: All five elements/senses on table, mastery of present moment

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's pull you back to right here, right now. Engage all five senses.
app_prompts.during: Look around. 5 things you see...4 things you feel...3 sounds...2 smells...1 taste.
app_prompts.post_practice: You're here. You're safe. You're grounded in this moment.

five_four_three_two_one.journal_prompt: How did your anxiety level change from start to finish?
five_four_three_two_one.clinical_note: Evidence-based for PTSD, panic disorder, dissociative disorders

sensory_exploration.name: Single Sense Deep Dive
sensory_exploration.description: Choose one sense and explore it deeply for 5 minutes.
instructions: Choose a sense (hearing, sight, touch, smell, taste)
HEARING: Every layer of sound (near, far, constant, intermittent)
SIGHT: Colors, shapes, shadows, movement, stillness
TOUCH: Textures, temperatures, air on skin, clothing
sensory_exploration.why_it_works: Develops concentration. Reveals richness of present moment.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Deep perception, seeing beyond surface

app_prompts.pre_practice: Choose one sense. We'll explore its entire universe.
app_prompts.during: What new layers are you discovering? What have you never noticed before?
app_prompts.post_practice: The present moment just revealed its depth.

sensory_exploration.journal_prompt: What did you discover that you'd never noticed before?

barefoot_grounding.name: Barefoot Earthing
barefoot_grounding.description: Stand barefoot on earth/grass. Physical and electrical grounding.
instructions: Stand on grass, dirt, sand, or stone
Imagine roots growing from soles into earth
Stand or walk slowly for 10 minutes
barefoot_grounding.why_it_works: Physical contact with earth has measurable effects on cortisol, inflammation, and nervous system regulation.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Receiving from earth, exchange of energy

app_prompts.pre_practice: Find a patch of earth. Let's ground you physically and electrically.
app_prompts.during: Feel the earth supporting you. You're held by something ancient and stable.
app_prompts.post_practice: Earth's electrons just flowed into you. Notice any shift?

barefoot_grounding.journal_prompt: How did your body feel before vs. after? Any energy shift?

loving_kindness.name: Loving-Kindness Meditation (Metta)
loving_kindness.description: Buddhist practice. Cultivate unconditional goodwill toward self and others.
instructions: Start with YOURSELF: 'May I be happy. May I be healthy. May I be safe. May I live with ease.'
BENEFACTOR (someone who's helped you): 'May you be happy. May you be healthy. May you be safe. May you live with ease.'
NEUTRAL PERSON (someone you barely know): Same phrases
ALL BEINGS: 'May all beings be happy, healthy, safe, and live with ease.'
loving_kindness.why_it_works: Activates left prefrontal cortex (wellbeing center). Increases compassion, reduces self-criticism.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Unconditional love, nurturing, abundance of care

app_prompts.pre_practice: We'll cultivate unconditional kindness, starting with yourself.
app_prompts.during: May I be happy. May I be healthy. May I be safe. May I live with ease. (Feel the wish.)
app_prompts.post_practice: You just practiced radical self-compassion and extended it outward.

loving_kindness.journal_prompt: Which person was hardest to send kindness to? Why?
loving_kindness.clinical_note: Evidence-based for depression, PTSD, chronic pain, social anxiety

breath_awareness.name: Simple Breath Awareness
breath_awareness.description: Foundation meditation. Just watch the breath.
instructions: Sit comfortably, eyes closed or lowered
Notice: Coolness at nostrils? Chest rising? Belly expanding?
When mind wanders (IT WILL), notice, return to breath
Wandering isn't failure. Returning is the practice.
breath_awareness.why_it_works: Strengthens attention. Reveals workings of mind. Develops metacognition.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Solitary practice, inner light, simplicity

app_prompts.pre_practice: No agenda. Just you and your breath.
app_prompts.during: Breathing in...breathing out. Mind wandered? That's okay. Return to breath.
app_prompts.post_practice: How many times did you notice your mind wander? That's awareness!

breath_awareness.journal_prompt: What was your mind most interested in thinking about today?

open_awareness.name: Open Monitoring (Choiceless Awareness)
open_awareness.description: Don't focus on anything specific. Notice whatever arises.
instructions: Sound arises? Notice it, let it pass
Be like sky: everything passes through, nothing sticks
open_awareness.why_it_works: Develops equanimity. Reduces reactivity. Sees impermanence directly.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Open, receptive, non-attached, zero point

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's practice being the sky. Everything passes through.
app_prompts.during: Sound...thought...sensation...emotion. Arising, passing. You're the space in which it all happens.
app_prompts.post_practice: Nothing stuck to you. Everything flowed through.

open_awareness.journal_prompt: What patterns did you notice in what arose?

visualization_safe_place.name: Safe Place Visualization
visualization_safe_place.description: Create inner sanctuary for nervous system regulation.
instructions: Imagine a place (real or imagined) where you feel completely safe
Beach? Forest? Childhood room? Fantasy location?
Engage all senses: What do you see? Hear? Smell? Feel?
Anchor: Choose object/symbol to represent this place (shell, feather, stone)
visualization_safe_place.why_it_works: Creates neural pathway to safety state. Portable calm-down tool.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Sanctuary, home, celebration of safety

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's build your inner sanctuary. Somewhere you're completely safe.
app_prompts.during: What do you see? Hear the sounds. Feel the textures. Smell the air. This is yours.
app_prompts.post_practice: You can return here anytime. It's always available.

visualization_safe_place.journal_prompt: Describe your safe place. What makes it safe?
visualization_safe_place.clinical_note: Used in trauma therapy, EMDR preparation

walking_meditation.name: Mindful Walking
walking_meditation.description: Moving meditation. Pay attention to each step.
instructions: Notice: Lifting foot, moving forward, placing down, shifting weight
Feel: Heel contact, ball of foot, toes pressing
If mind wanders, return to sensation of walking
Can be done anywhere (hallway, park, loop)
walking_meditation.why_it_works: Integrates mindfulness with movement. Accessible for those who struggle sitting still.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Journey, being present to each step

app_prompts.pre_practice: Each step is a meditation. Let's walk with full awareness.
app_prompts.during: Lifting...moving...placing. Feel the earth meeting your foot.
app_prompts.post_practice: You just practiced being present while moving. Take this into daily life.

walking_meditation.journal_prompt: What did you notice about how you walk?

mindful_stretching.name: Mindful Stretching
mindful_stretching.description: Gentle stretches with full attention to sensations.
instructions: Slowly raise arms overhead - notice shoulders, chest opening
Stay at edge of comfort, breathe into stretch
mindful_stretching.why_it_works: Combines body awareness with gentle movement. Releases tension mindfully.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Mindful practice, attention to craft (body)

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's explore your body's edges gently.
app_prompts.during: Breathe into the stretch. What do you feel? Honor your limits.
app_prompts.post_practice: You listened to your body and gave it what it needed.

mindful_stretching.journal_prompt: Where was tightest? Where felt best?

shaking_practice.name: Somatic Shaking (TRE-inspired)
shaking_practice.description: Let body shake to release stored stress/trauma.
instructions: Start bouncing gently on balls of feet
Arms, legs, torso - let them shake
shaking_practice.why_it_works: Animals shake after threats to discharge adrenaline. Humans need this too. Releases incomplete stress responses.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Shaking loose what needs to fall, release, liberation

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's shake off what you've been carrying.
app_prompts.during: Let your body do what it needs. Shake, tremble, release.
app_prompts.post_practice: Feel that? Your nervous system just completed a cycle.

shaking_practice.journal_prompt: What did you feel during and after? Any emotions arise?

mindful_eating.name: Mindful Eating Practice
mindful_eating.description: Eat one food item with complete attention.
instructions: Choose one food (raisin, chocolate, orange slice)
LOOK: Really see it. Colors, texture, shape
TOUCH: Feel it. Soft? Rough? Temperature?
SMELL: Bring to nose. What do you notice?
PLACE IN MOUTH: Don't chew yet. Notice on tongue.
CHEW SLOWLY: Texture changing? Flavors emerging?
mindful_eating.why_it_works: Interrupts automatic eating. Increases satisfaction. Reveals how often we're NOT present.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Earthly pleasure, sensory gift, presence

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's eat one raisin like you've never tasted food before.
app_prompts.during: Look at it...really look. Now smell. Now taste. Chew slowly. Notice everything.
app_prompts.post_practice: When's the last time you were that present with food?

mindful_eating.journal_prompt: How is mindful eating different from usual? Can you do this once per meal?

mindful_dishwashing.name: Mindful Dishwashing (Thich Nhat Hanh)
mindful_dishwashing.description: Wash dishes to wash dishes, not to get dishes clean.
instructions: Stand at sink, feel feet on floor
Feel texture of dish, soap, sponge
Hear sound of water, dishes clinking
If thinking about after-dishes plans, return to sensation
This moment is the only moment
mindful_dishwashing.why_it_works: Transforms chore into meditation. Practices being present with 'boring' tasks.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Patience with process, tending garden, valuing work

app_prompts.pre_practice: Let's turn this chore into a meditation.
app_prompts.during: Warm water on hands. Smooth ceramic. Slippery soap. Just this.
app_prompts.post_practice: You were fully present for something you usually rush through.

mindful_dishwashing.journal_prompt: What other daily tasks can you transform into mindfulness practice?

morning_intentions.name: Morning Intention Setting
morning_intentions.description: Set intention for the day before getting out of bed.
instructions: Before checking phone, sit on edge of bed
Ask: 'How do I want to FEEL today?'
Choose one quality (calm, curious, kind, focused, playful)
Ask: 'How do I want to SHOW UP today?'
morning_intentions.why_it_works: Engages prefrontal cortex before autopilot mode. Sets tone before reactive mode kicks in.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Conscious creation, 'As above, so below', intention manifests

app_prompts.pre_practice: Before the day sweeps you away, let's set your intention.
app_prompts.during: How do you want to feel today? Choose one word.
app_prompts.post_practice: You've planted a seed. Notice when this quality shows up today.

morning_intentions.journal_prompt: What intention did you set? Did you notice it influencing your day?

gratitude_practice.name: Three Good Things (Gratitude)
instructions: Before bed, write three good things from today
They can be tiny ('good coffee', 'sun on face')
For each, write WHY it was good
Feel the feeling as you write
Do daily for 1 week, see effects
gratitude_practice.why_it_works: Retrains brain's negativity bias. Increases happiness, decreases depression (Seligman research).

tarot_correspondences.reason: Joy, vitality, seeing the light

app_prompts.pre_practice: What went well today? Even small things count.
app_prompts.during: 1. What? 2. Why was it good? 3. How did it feel?
app_prompts.post_practice: Your brain just learned to look for good. Do this daily.

gratitude_practice.journal_prompt: After one week: Are you noticing more good things as they happen?
gratitude_practice.clinical_note: Studied by Martin Seligman (positive psychology founder). 6 months of practice = lasting happiness increase.

tech_free_morning.name: Phone-Free First Hour
tech_free_morning.description: Don't check phone for first hour after waking.
instructions: Place phone charger outside bedroom (or far from bed)
First hour: Stretch, breathe, coffee, journal, shower
NO email, news, social media, texts
Let your brain wake up on its own terms
tech_free_morning.why_it_works: Prevents cortisol spike from starting day in reactive mode. Preserves morning neuroplasticity for intentional use.

tarot_correspondences.reason: Solitude, inner-directed, not buffeted by outside world

app_prompts.pre_practice: Tomorrow morning: phone stays put for first hour.
app_prompts.during: Noticing urge to check? That's addiction speaking. Breathe through it.
app_prompts.post_practice: You started your day on YOUR terms, not your phone's.

tech_free_morning.journal_prompt: How did it feel? What did you do instead? How was your day different?

pause_practice.name: The Sacred Pause
pause_practice.description: Insert tiny pause between stimulus and response.
instructions: Viktor Frankl: 'Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power.'
pause_practice.why_it_works: Creates space for prefrontal cortex (wise mind) instead of amygdala (reactive mind).

tarot_correspondences.reason: Pause, suspension, seeing from new angle before acting

app_prompts.pre_practice: Next time you're triggered, pause for 3 breaths.
app_prompts.during: Breathe 1...notice the urge...breathe 2...feel it...breathe 3...now choose.
app_prompts.post_practice: You just exercised freedom. That's the gap between stimulus and response.

pause_practice.journal_prompt: When did you use this today? How did the outcome differ?

achievements.name: Loving-Kindness Warrior
achievements.description: Send metta to difficult person 5 times

achievements.name: Daily Devotion
achievements.description: Practice mindfulness 30 days in a row

achievements.name: Here Now
achievements.description: Complete all 28 mindfulness exercises at least once

swords.why: Clarity, mental focus, cutting through reactivity

evidence_base: Kabat-Zinn, J. (1990). Full Catastrophe Living. MBSR foundation.
Linehan, M. (2015). DBT Skills Training Manual. Mindfulness module.
Seligman, M. (2011). Flourish. Three Good Things research.
Huberman, A. (2022). Physiological Sigh research, Stanford.
Brown, R. & Gerbarg, P. (2012). The Healing Power of the Breath. Coherent breathing.
Salzberg, S. (1995). Loving-Kindness: The Revolutionary Art of Happiness. Metta practice.
Thich Nhat Hanh. (1975). The Miracle of Mindfulness. Mindful daily activities.
van der Kolk, B. (2014). The Body Keeps the Score. Somatic practices.

app_features.guided_audio: Each practice includes optional guided audio with timer
app_features.customization: Adjust duration, background sounds, voice/no voice
app_features.progress_tracking: Track which practices used, frequency, favorite
app_features.smart_suggestions: App suggests practice based on: time of day, recent mood logs, cards drawn
app_features.integration_with_readings: Card pulls can recommend specific practices (Tower ‚Üí 5-4-3-2-1 grounding)
app_features.favorites: Save your go-to practices for quick access
